Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2015 11:17AM mal1230 wrote: Usually the free mammogram programs will give you an exception if they feel you need it. I am under 40 and could have gotten an exception, but my income was "too high". If you qualify income wise, you may still be able to get it. I'd call them.
Posts.Title: My husband won't put me on his insurance mombo4 bobogirl

Posts.Content: mal1230 wrote: I'm 31, underweight (my whole family is tiny), and have no family history of breast cancer, yet I find myself terrified about inflammatory breast cancer. My right breast is swollen and I have swollen lymph nodes under my arm (that have been there since before the breast swelling - I have been sick for about a month now) and I can't find anything that would cause that besides this. I have stretch marks from the swelling. My right breast has always been bigger than the left one, but because of this and what it's done to my mind, I don't even know how much of a difference it has made. It seems like a huge difference, but I don't even know. I had an ultrasound which was normal, but from what I understand, an ultrasound wouldn't pick this up. Here are my concerns / questions: 1. I have an appointment with a GYN tomorrow to get more information. I do not have insurance until 2/1 and if she wants to send me for a biopsy, I don't know what to do. From what I read, this cancer doesn't wait. Any suggestions? 2. What else can cause unilateral breast swelling? It's not painful, hot, itchy, etc. and I don't have children. Thank you so much - and to everyone that is battling this cancer and any type of cancer, keep fighting!! You're in my thoughts and prayers. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Biopsy and Other Possibilities mal1230 mal1230

Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2015 01:41PM mal1230 wrote: Thank you - I'm in Tampa :)

Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2015 03:22PM mal1230 wrote: Thank you so much. I asked my boyfriend and he said it looks swollen, but he can't tell a huge difference (I'm not sure if he's just saying that to make me feel better). What's freaking me out is when I take a picture just to see, it looks like there is a HUGE difference, but when I look in the mirror, it doesn't. I don't know.... Thank you so much for your reply - I really appreciate it. I'm on antibiotics for a sinus infection myself. I wish you the best.
